title: Using 3rd party app for blocking spam callers & texts on Google phone/Google Fi?
content: I have a Pixel 3XL (Pixel 5 on order!) and use Google Fi as my mobile phone provider. Online research has shown that neither Google Fi or Google phones have the ability to block "wildcards" such as area codes/exchanges. I get multiple "neighbor spoofing" calls every day and intend to add a 3rd party app from the Google Play Store to accomplish this. I'm considering Mr. Number (currently using free trial) or Blacklist Pro. Do I need to disable the Google phone spam filters for a 3rd party app to function properly? Anyone have an opinion on which of these apps work best? I want to block both calls and texts. Don't mind a small subscription charge.
